reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Ex-post evaluation of FLOM projects in Mongolia

description.narrative: Ex post - evaluation of the MFA financed projects implemented by FLOM-M. The purpose of the evaluation is to review the impacts and sustainability of four development projects implemented by FLOM in Mongolia (FLOM-M) since it was established and financed with the aid of the Finnish Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MFA) and to give recommendations for further development work of FLOM-M. The main beneficiaries for this post evaluation are FLOM-Mongolia staff FLOM Home office staff (Kylvaja) and their cooperatin g partners. Another beneficiary is the Finnish Ministry of Foreign Affairs (NGO unit) as the main donor of the development projects. The findings of the evaluation will be used for improvement of projects that FLOM-M is currently implementing and effectiv e development planning and implementation of new development work in the future. The 4 projects to be evaluated are:1. Arkhangai training and health project 2005-20072. Leadership Training through Traditional and Virtual Teaching 2009-20103. ?New key? Aw areness and skills training for women in Ulaanbaatar 2009-20114. Information Society for Zavkhan Province 2009-2012The evaluation will be focused on 3 main areas:1. The impact on the target groups of each project and the sustainability of the effects2. The way FLOM-M operates in relationship with the project partners and other local governmental and non-governmental organizations3. The way the implemented projects influenced decision-making by partners other NGO?s and governmental organizations as a spin-of f of the projects. (For more detailed description of evaluation questions please see the attached Terms of Reference)The objective is to define the main outputs and outcomes resulting from the implementation of the projects identify effects on main benefic iaries and the extent to which cross cutting development objectives of each project have been reached describe their sustainability and the best practices and lessons learned for the possible future activities.
